answerText: Don Quixote de La Mancha [or Alonso Quijano][10] At one point, Don Quixote believes that a barber's wash-basin is actually the helmet of this Moorish king. The powers of this king's helmet to grant invulnerability are detailed in Orlando Furioso and Orlando Innamorata.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Penn A + Chicago B | 14 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At one point, this character believes his brain is melting because of curds placed in his helmet. For 10 points each:  [10] Name this character who names Sancho Panza as his squire and tilts at windmills he believes to be giants.
